ouster.translation[0].definitions[0].def: when someone is removed from a position of power or from a competition – used in news reports
ouster.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: the ouster of the brutal dictatorship
ouster.translation[1].definitions[0].def: an act of removing someone from a powerful job, position etc in order to take their place
ouster.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The board faced an ouster by shareholders after it rejected a $55-a-share offer.
